perturbation.original_text: Agent shall accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing for a period of ten days from and including the Sale Commencement Date. Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing.
perturbation.changed_text: Agent shall determine whether to accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing. Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept returns of goods sold by Merchant prior to the Closing.
perturbation.explanation: This weakens the consumer's right to return goods sold before the closing, making it subject to the agent's discretion, which contradicts consumer protection laws requiring honoring pre-existing return policies for a reasonable period.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state, but generally state consumer protection laws regarding honoring existing return policies.

perturbation.original_text: Agent shall accept Merchant's gift certificates, gift cards, store credits, return credits, or similar merchandise credits issued by Merchant (collectively, "Gift Certificates") for a period of ten days from and including the Sale Commencement Date. Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept Gift Certificates.
perturbation.changed_text: Agent may determine whether to accept Merchant's gift certificates, gift cards, store credits, return credits, or similar merchandise credits issued by Merchant (collectively, "Gift Certificates"). Thereafter, Agent shall have no obligation to accept Gift Certificates.
perturbation.explanation: This change gives the agent the discretion to refuse gift certificates, potentially violating state laws that require businesses to honor gift certificates for a specified period or until their value is exhausted. This omission creates a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state, but generally state gift certificate laws.

perturbation.original_text: All sales of Merchandise will be "final sales" and "as is," and appropriate signage and sales receipts will reflect the same. Agent shall not warrant the Merchandise in any manner, but will, to the extent legally permissible, pass on all manufacturers' warranties to customers.
perturbation.changed_text: All sales of Merchandise will be "final sales" and "as is," and appropriate signage and sales receipts will reflect the same. Agent shall not warrant the Merchandise in any manner.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause about passing on manufacturers' warranties, the contract now implies that customers receive no warranty whatsoever, which contradicts consumer rights that mandate the implied warranty of merchantability, especially since many of the Stores are located in states that do not allow disclaimers on implied warranties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Article 2 - Implied Warranty of Merchantability (state-specific adoptions of the UCC)
